amendment.description: Amendment provided that, in cases where a source of pathogenic contamination is identified, the State or local government shall make information on the existence of such source available to the public on the Internet within 24 hours of the identification of such source.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 5 printed in the Congressional Record to provide that in cases where a source of pathogenic contamination is identified, the State or local government shall make information on the existence of such source available to the public on the Internet within 24 hours of the identification of such source.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Kucinich amendment (A005) Agreed to by voice vote.
